Class Resource

java.lang.Object
WorkLoad.Resource
public class Resource extends Object
Represents a single physical (or logical) resource instance managed by a SharedResource pool.

A Resource carries an identifier, a back-reference to its parent SharedResource, the Job that currently holds the lock (if any), and a relative end time indicating when the current lock expires.

Inline comments in the original file are respected: Resource objects are short-lived holders used by locking/unlocking operations in the simulator's resource management routines.

Author:
ShiuJia

  • Method Details

    • setLockedBy

      public void setLockedBy(Job j)
      Mark this resource as locked by a specific job.
      Parameters:
      j - the Job acquiring the lock on this resource

    • unlock

      public void unlock()
      Release this resource, clearing any lock and resetting the relative end time.

    • whoLocked

      public Job whoLocked()
      Return the Job that currently holds this resource lock, or null when the resource is free.
      Returns:
      the Job holding the lock or null

    • setID

      public void setID(int id)
      Set the integer identifier for this resource.
      Parameters:
      id - the id to assign

    • setParentResource

      public void setParentResource(SharedResource r)
      Assign the owning SharedResource container for this resource.
      Parameters:
      r - the parent SharedResource

    • setRelativeEndTime

      public void setRelativeEndTime(double t)
      Set the relative end time for the current lock on this resource.
      Parameters:
      t - the relative end time (units consistent with the simulator)

    • getID

      public int getID()
      Return this resource's identifier.
      Returns:
      the resource ID

    • getParentResource

      public SharedResource getParentResource()
      Return the SharedResource that owns this Resource instance.
      Returns:
      the parent SharedResource

    • getRelativeEndTime

      public double getRelativeEndTime()
      Return the relative end time for the current lock.
      Returns:
      the relative end time (0 if unlocked)
